newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-ELLIOTT AND PONTING IN UNBROKEN DOUBLE CENTURY STAND.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-ELLIOTT AND PONTING IN UNBROKEN DOUBLE CENTURY STAND.

text.p: An unbeaten 134 by opener Matthew Elliott, who shared an unbroken stand of 208 with Ricky Ponting, put Australia well on the way to victory in the fourth test against England on Friday.
Ponting was also undefeated at the close with 86 as Australia reached 258 for four in their first innings after dismissing England for 172, a lead of 86.
Earlier paceman Jason Gillespie wrecked England's first innings with test best figures of seven for 37.
Resuming at 106 for three, England lost their last seven wickets in the space of only 34 runs. Captain Mike Atherton was their top scorer with 41.
Australia looked in trouble as they lost their first four wickets for 50 but Elliott, who was dropped twice, and Ponting took control with some aggressive batting.
